content: Hello! Thanks for contacting XYZ Home Services. How can I help you today?
Hi, my kitchen sink is leaking a little. I'm not sure if I should even bother calling someone.
Thank you for reaching out. We would be happy to help fix your leaking sink! Can I get your name to get started?

It's Jess. But honestly, every plumber I've contacted wants a fortune and never shows up anyway. Will you actually show up? And is your price going to be reasonable, or is this just another waste of my time?

Thank you, Jess! We aim to be reliable and offer fair pricing. Would you like a price estimate for repairing your leaking sink? Also, could I get your address to see if you’re within our service area?

It's 145 Evergreen Ave. But I just know I'm going to get charged a 'visit fee' and then something else on top of that. I had a plumber last year who charged me just to walk through the door and then said he couldn't even fix it that day.

Thank you for your address, Jess. We understand your concerns about unexpected fees—transparency matters to us. We can provide an estimate based on your description, and will be clear if anything changes before doing any work. Would you like me to provide a price estimate for your sink repair?
You can try, but nobody ever tells the real price anyway. Fine. What's your estimate?
Thank you! Please confirm—besides the leak, is there any other issue with the sink, or is it just the leak? Any visible damage to the pipe, or does the leak happen only when the water is running?
It's a steady drip under the sink when the water's running. That's all I see. I'm not a plumber, so I don't know if something else is wrong. Isn't that enough for an estimate?

Thank you for clarifying, Jess. Based on your description, a typical repair for a steady drip under the sink usually ranges between $80 and $150, depending on what part needs replacement. There is a standard service call fee included, which goes toward the repair cost if you move forward. Would you like to schedule a time for a technician to come out and take a look?
I don't know. I just want it fixed without being ripped off. What if I schedule and then you charge me more? Or if the part is something small and you still charge a ton?

I understand your concern, Jess. Our technician will assess the issue and explain any additional costs before starting repairs. No work is done without your approval, and if it's a simple fix, we'll let you know before replacing any parts. Would you like to pick a date and time that works best for you?
I'm not convinced. How do I know you won't be late, or that your techs are actually qualified? I've read horror stories. And what if the estimate is wrong? Plus, I'm busy most days.

Our technicians are licensed, background-checked, and strive to arrive on time. We’ll provide you updates on appointment timing as well. Estimates are based on typical repairs, but you’re always in control before any work is done. I’d like to help—could you let me know if there’s a specific day or window that’s easier for you to find time?
Let me think about it. Honestly, I'm just not sure this is going to work out. Every time I try to get help, it turns into a mess.
reason: Customer not satisfied, declined to schedule.
